Package controller

Class HomeMenuController

java.lang.Object
controller.HomeMenuController
public class HomeMenuController extends Object
This is HomeMenuController class which receives an input from the user via the HomeMenuView, then processes the user's data with the help of HomeMenuModel and updates HomeMenuView.

  • Method Details

    • checkMouseClicked

      public void checkMouseClicked(MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is used to define some actions performed when the mouse button has been clicked (pressed and released) on this component. The actions are as followed: 1. If the mouse button clicks on the so-called "Start button", display game board. 2. If the mouse button clicks on the so-called "Exit button", terminates this program. 3. If the mouse button clicks on the so-called "Info button", display the InfoPageView Window.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - a low-level event which indicates that a mouse action occurred in a component (generated when a mouse button is pressed, released or clicked (pressed and released), or when the mouse cursor enters or exits the unobscured part of component's geometry)

    • checkMousePressed

      public void checkMousePressed(MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is used to define some actions performed when the mouse button has been pressed on this component. The actions are as followed: 1. If the mouse button clicks on the so-called "Start button", repaint the start button. 2. If the mouse button clicks on the so-called "Exit button", repaint the exit button. 3. If the mouse button clicks on the so-called "Info button", repaint the info button.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - a low-level event which indicates that a mouse action occurred in a component (generated when a mouse button is pressed, released or clicked (pressed and released), or when the mouse cursor enters or exits the unobscured part of component's geometry)

    • checkMouseReleased

      public void checkMouseReleased(MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is used to define some actions performed when the mouse button has been released on this component. The actions are as followed: 1. If the mouse button clicks on the so-called "Start button", repaint the start button. 2. If the mouse button clicks on the so-called "Exit button", repaint the exit button. 3. If the mouse button clicks on the so-called "Info button", repaint the info button.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - a low-level event which indicates that a mouse action occurred in a component (generated when a mouse button is pressed, released or clicked (pressed and released), or when the mouse cursor enters or exits the unobscured part of component's geometry)

    • checkMouseMoved

      public void checkMouseMoved(MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is used to define some actions performed when the mouse cursor has been moved onto this component but no buttons have been pushed. When mouse cursor move to the so-called "Start button", "Exit button" ot "Info button", set the cursor image to hand cursor, otherwise, set the cursor image as the default cursor.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - a low-level event which indicates that a mouse action occurred in a component (generated when a mouse button is pressed, released or clicked (pressed and released), or when the mouse cursor enters or exits the unobscured part of component's geometry)
